tool.name: Quality control
tool.description: Performs quality control on FASTQ reads.
tool.command:
quasitools quality
## Preparing file input. #if $data_type.type == "paired":
'$data_type.fastq_input1' '$data_type.fastq_input2'
#elif $data_type.type == "collection":
'$data_type.fastq_input1.forward' '$data_type.fastq_input1.reverse'
#elif $data_type.type == "single":
'$data_type.fastq_input1'
#end if
#if $length_cutoff: -lc '$length_cutoff' #end if
#if $score_cutoff: -sc '$score_cutoff' #end if
#if $min_read_qual: -rq '$min_read_qual' #end if
#if $low_quality.qual_selector == "filter_ns": --ns #elif $low_quality.qual_selector == "mask_reads": --mask_reads #end if
#if $score_type.score_selector == "median": --median #elif $score_type.score_selector == "mean": --mean #end if
$trim_reads
-o output

param.name: length_cutoff
param.label: Length cutoff
param.help: Reads which fall short of the specified length will be filtered out. Defaults to 100.

param.name: score_cutoff
param.label: Score cutoff
param.help: Reads whose average quality score is less than the specified score will be filtered out. Defaults to 30.

param.name: min_read_qual
param.label: Minimum quality
param.help: Minimum required quality for a position in a read not to be masked, is masking is enabled. Defaults to 30.

param.name: trim_reads
param.label: Trim reads
param.help: Iteratively trim reads based on filter values if enabled.

param.name: qual_selector
param.label: Filter out regions masked, or mask low coverage regions with n's.
param.option: Mask low coverage regions with n's
Do not filter or mask low coverage regions.

param.name: score_selector
param.label: Use either median score (default) or mean score for the score cutoff value.

tool.help:
Quality =======
Perform quality control on FASTQ reads.
